data.title: Law and Justice
data.meta_description: With a degree in Law and Justice you can pursue a career in social work, homeland security, law enforcement education, counseling, and public safety fields.
data.text:
Degree Options

Our program strives to provide you with a comprehensive educational and professional experience, incorporating opportunities such as field trips, educational panels, conferences, undergraduate legal and justice-focused internships, and access to the Law and Justice Club.

Undergraduate

Law and Justice, BA

Graduate

Law and Justice, MS

Minors and Certificate

Law and Justice Minor

Admissions

For general university admissions information, contact the Office of Admissions. For advising information, contact the Academic Advising Center.

Are you a graduate student? Contact the School of Graduate Studies and Research for admissions information.

Highlights

The Mock Trial

Joining CWUâ€™s Mock Trial Club will give you the chance to travel and compete in local or national Mock Trials, meet people with similar interests and establish connections. This club is a great way to gain experience in the legal field and has opportunities for all types of individuals with different strengths and ideas.
